CATEGORY · E-COMMERCE

E-commerce with AI: Why Most Tools Can't Build Real Stores

Most AI website builders treat e-commerce as an afterthought. They'll generate a product page template, but actual store functionality—variants, inventory, shipping zones, tax calculation—is missing or severely limited.

Quick reality check: Most AI website builders treat e-commerce as an afterthought. They'll generate a product page template, but actual store functionality—variants, inventory, shipping zones, tax calculation—is missing or severely limited.

What actually matters for e-commerce

Product variants (this is the big one)

Selling t-shirts? You need sizes (S, M, L, XL) and colors. Selling software? You need licenses (single, team, enterprise). Most AI builders can't handle this. Framer can't do variants at all—each option would be a separate product. Durable has basic variants but they're clunky. Only 10Web with WooCommerce has proper product variations.

Inventory management

When you sell 5 units of something, the system should know you have 5 fewer. Basic stuff. Framer doesn't track inventory at all. Durable sort of does but it's rudimentary. 10Web with WooCommerce has full inventory tracking with low-stock alerts.

Payment processing that actually works

All of these integrate Stripe or PayPal. But the implementation matters. 10Web gives you full WooCommerce payment gateways—Stripe, PayPal, Square, local payments. Framer gives you a "buy" button that you have to manually configure to link somewhere else. Durable has basic checkout but limited payment options.

Shipping zones and tax calculation

If you're selling physical products, you need to charge different shipping rates based on location and calculate sales tax by region. 10Web handles this automatically. Durable? Flat-rate shipping only, no tax zones. Framer? Not applicable—you don't have a real cart.

So what should you use?

10Web + WooCommerce — Only option with real e-commerce features: variants, inventory, shipping, taxes.

Read the full review (47-product store build)

Things that drove me crazy

No product variants

Framer can't handle sizes/colors. Each variant would be a separate product.

No inventory tracking

Framer and Durable dont track inventory. 10Web does.

Shipping/tax handling

Only 10Web handles zones and tax calculation properly.
